page.title: 04CWM GWAUN
page.content:
Down in the valley in the shade, Walking between the trees. In the shade,to sit down, Don't give the slightest frown. Formed by a glacier,moving slow, The sun came out and made it go, Leaving no trace of snow, Only a place for things to grow.
Whilst walking along the banks of the Gwaun we all noticed a change in the atmosphere from a clearing where the sun beat down upon us, to a dark,moist environment filled with mosses and moisture loving plants.Although these features are difficult to quantify they most certainly exist and had a very definite effect on all who followed the route through the valley.
